newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lankan stocks close firmer on local buying.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lankan stocks close firmer on local buying.

text.p: Sri Lankan stocks closed slightly higher on Monday on belief by local investors that corporate performance would improve, brokers said.
The all share index closed 1.64 points higher at 593.03.
"Investors expect better corporate results for the three months ended september 30," said Subram Ramasamy of Bartleet Mallory Stock Brokers.

Lanka Lubricants, a Caltex subsidiary, began trading but no deals were reported on the first day due to a mismatch between buyers and sellers. Buyers cited 40 rupees a share while sellers sought 50 rupees
Gainers led decliners by 22 to 11. Commercial Bank rose 2.75 rupees to 110.75 and Haycarb two to 77.
First half industrial output was hit by a drought which led to daily power cuts averaging five hours between March and August.
Turnover was a moderate 16.36 million rupees. Foreign purchases were limited to 4.1 million rupees.
